requirements: Prerequisite: LING 520 or permission of the instructor.
description:
Introduction to phonology as a system for combining units of speech (constriction gestures of the vocal organs) into larger structures. Analysis of articulatory movement data; modeling using techniques of dynamical systems. Emphasis on universal vs. language-particular aspects of gestural combination and coordination.
Prerequisite: LING 520 or permission of the instructor.
title: Articulatory Phonology
